content: What ancient civilization built the iconic pyramids at Giza?

The ancient civilization that built the iconic pyramids at Giza was the Old Kingdom of Egypt, specifically during the Fourth Dynasty around 2580-2560 BC. The most famous of these pyramids are the Great Pyramid of Khufu, the Pyramid of Khafre, and the Pyramid of Menkaure. These monumental structures were built as tombs for pharaohs and served as symbols of their power and divine status.
